Example in the Context of Learning to Learn

Ahmad decided to cut every unnecessary digital tool and concentrate in using a single, simple and safe digital learning management system that allows him to assign tasks, set deadlines, and give feedback to his students.

He also asked his students to use the online calendar to plan their own work, create a material list, and track their progress.

He also explained to them how to use digital task managers – such as mind-maps or online whiteboards – to break down the information into manageable pieces and thereby assist students in organising their learning.
